mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Ruddock, S. A. (Samuel Abiel), 1767?-1828
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Informs he is son of John Ruddock, of Boston, only man who defended liberty of U.S. with Gov. Samuel Adams; in 1799 twenty masters of American vessels in Jamaica petitioned for him to be American agent there in place of Savage; Dr. Jarvis and Dr. Wm. Eustice acquainted with him in Boston; well qualified and willing to serve country in a foreign office.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Adams, Samuel, 1722-1803
Eustice, William, 1753-1825
Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1803 January 8, Charleston, SC, to Tho[ma]s Jefferson, Washington, [D.C.].
